bio:
Nick AM is Nick Momeni. Born in Manhattan to Iranian immigrants, Momeni’s artistry marries family heritage and contemporary influence. Following the Iranian revolution in the 1980’s, Momeni’s grandfather started a new life in New York City, selling Persian rugs and establishing the family business that still lives on today. 

Momeni’s love of house and electronic music was born from familial influence as well. His parents would often bring home mix CD’s from their travels, exposing him to Western pop and dance music and eventually spurring his obsession for house music with a mix brought from San Tropez. Momeni has chased electronic music ever since— coming of age in New York’s underground club scene and learning to produce through friends.

releases.releaseDescription: The buoyantly hypnotic 'Take It Back' comes from Nick AM's sophomore EP, 'Utopia'. Bridging the electronic sounds of the New York scene in which he exists and the traditional Persian music of his ancestry, the track is inspired by the political tension that exists between his two homelands.

Taking an experimental approach to ancestral sounds, the Iranian-American producer’s sophomore EP reinterprets his heritage, devising inherited music into contemporary electronic compositions for the new revolution.

“The quest for utopia is the root of conflict, thus a perfect society cannot exist,” says
Nick of the project. “The consequences of Iran’s conflict with the west and the fear of
war between my current home and my motherland inspired my process.”

Fuelled by the limited media coverage surrounding protests in Iran and amplified by the 2020 Black Lives Matter protests, 'Power' is for anyone who has to take to the streets. 

The club edit serves as an ode to Nick’s coming of age among the city’s underground scene, reimagining the track for a nocturnal setting.
